org.apache.bigtop.itest

Class ParameterSetter

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.apache.bigtop.itest.ParameterSetter

  • public class ParameterSetter
extends java.lang.Object
    Class containing utility methods for test classes to use (in a static setup method) for obtaining the values of parameters passed in via environment variables or system properties. The parameters are obtained by introspecting the Contract annotation of the test class.

    • Method Detail

      • setEnv

        public static void setEnv(java.lang.Class target)
                   throws java.lang.NoSuchFieldException,
                          java.lang.IllegalAccessException
        Sets the values of parameters passed in via environment variables, using convention. Assumes the presence in the target class of static fields (the parameters) with the same names as the environment variables. (Unix/Linux environment variable names shall consist solely of uppercase letters, digits, and the '_' (underscore) character, and shall not begin with a digit.) If an environment variable is required and it is not set, an AssertionError is thrown.
        Parameters:
        target - the test class
        Throws:
        java.lang.NoSuchFieldException
        java.lang.IllegalAccessException

      • setEnv

        public static void setEnv(java.lang.Class target,
          java.lang.String[] fieldNames)
                   throws java.lang.NoSuchFieldException,
                          java.lang.IllegalAccessException
        Sets the values of parameters passed in via environment variables. Assumes the presence in the target class of static fields with the given names. If an environment variable is required and it is not set, an AssertionError is thrown.
        Parameters:
        target - the test class
        fieldNames - the names of the static fields corresponding to the environment variables; the number of names must match the number of environment variables
        Throws:
        java.lang.NoSuchFieldException
        java.lang.IllegalAccessException

      • setProperties

        public static void setProperties(java.lang.Class target)
                          throws java.lang.NoSuchFieldException,
                                 java.lang.IllegalAccessException
        Sets the values of parameters passed in via system properties, using convention. Assumes the presence in the target class of static fields (the parameters) with the same names as the system properties, except with '.' replaced by '_'. (The names of the system properties shall be chosen so that the corresponding field names are valid Java identifiers.) If a system property is not set, the parameter is set to a default value. Therefore usable default values must be provided in the annotation or else test logic must be written to handle the lack thereof.
        Parameters:
        target - the test class
        Throws:
        java.lang.NoSuchFieldException
        java.lang.IllegalAccessException

      • setProperties

        public static void setProperties(java.lang.Class target,
                 java.lang.String[] fieldNames)
                          throws java.lang.NoSuchFieldException,
                                 java.lang.IllegalAccessException
        Sets the values of parameters passed in via system properties. Assumes the presence in the target class of static fields with the given names. If a system property is not set, the parameter is set to a default value. Therefore usable default values must be provided in the annotation or else test logic must be written to handle the lack thereof.
        Parameters:
        target - the test class
        fieldNames - the names of the static fields corresponding to the system properties; the number of names must match the number of system properties
        Throws:
        java.lang.NoSuchFieldException
        java.lang.IllegalAccessException
